intro: Latace volkmannii, commonly known as the Volkmann's latace, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
